description.narrative: Omprogrammerade medel för att bekämpa covid-19 Denna insats genomförs inom ramen för ett stort social service projekt som etiopiska regeringen och Världsbanken genomför. ESAP programmet bidrar till att främja dialog, deltagande och samarbete mellan de som ska erhålla service och de som levererar social service i syfte att göra öka kvalitet och kvantitet på servicen. Andra finansiärer till insatsen är USAID, Irish Aid, Austria Aid, EU and DfiD.
Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19 Support to improved service delivery at local level through strengthened dialogue and interaction between service providers and those receiving the services.

The expected result of the ESAP III is to 'Support strengthening the social accountability system and mechanisms for enhanced service delivery in Ethiopia' by - Expanding the uptake of social accountability tools including community empowerment and mobilization, community needs identification and prioritization processes, interface meetings and development of joint action plans. - Building capacity and systems strengthening to gradually institutionalize through sectors, CBOs, councils and other citizens' representative forums at federal, regional, woreda and community levels.

description.narrative:
ESAP3's strategy shift in 2020 meant that the MA needed to terminate the agreements of the existing SAIPs and prepare a new request for expression of interest that is aligned to the new adopted strategy. As such, the MA managed to close out all agreements in the second quarter of 2021 with all SAIPs. It has however, simultaneously worked on on the REOI and then after RFPs that led to selection of best suited SAIPs for signing new agreements. As of the end of the year 2021, the MA had engaged eight SAIPs to operate in 107 woredas some of which are new woredas. In here, it is important to note that in 2022, the number of woredas will be increased to 416 from the existing 317 woredas. Therefore, the MA had already started including the new woredas in its new agreements that it entered with SAIPs.
On a more technical level, at the beginning of the year 2021, the MA had started piloting new tools for SA such as the Citizen Report Card, CRC, to set minimum standards for various services. Moreover, various training modules have been developed and updated to be used as the pre-disbursement training for SAIPs that will enter into agreement with the MA. During this past year, there were several challenges including the escalation of the northern conflict and the declaration of the State of Emergency, which impeded the MA to re-start social accountability work in the selected woredas. MA's staff safety was a major concern to restart the work in woredas that are out of the capital, Addis Ababa. During the Joint Review and Implementation Support (JRIS) Mission in November 2021, donors and the government agreed that the MA should start SA work in areas that were not affected by conflict including in Addis Ababa. MA's fiduciary concerns with the WB needed to be addressed in order to fulfill the MEL limitation due to travel ban in parts of the country. The entire MEL was revisited in order for the MA to capture and report on results more efficiently. The MA will submit a revised MEL plan during 2022 which will be embedded in the annual workplan and budget for 2022.
Other important achievements of the year include the drafting of the FTA-SA-GRM (financial transparency and accountability, social accountability and grievance redress mechanism) linkage guidelines and the guidelines for the transition of woredas from ESAP3 to MoF's managed ESAP IDA20. The latter is an exist strategy for ESAP3, that will slowly transition woredas under the current program to the government which is a step in the right direction to institutionalize Social Accountability in governance structure of the country. Sweden and other donors welcome the plan of phase one transfer of 60 woredas in 2022 from ESAP3 to IDA20, however, there are still unanswered question on how the IDA20 program will include CSOs in the SA work. This concern has been conveyed in several occasions and the World Bank, MoF and the MA will try and address this issue in consultation with ACSO, Authority for Civil Society Organizations.
At the Steering Committee meeting in early 2021, donors agreed that implementation pace of program had been slow due to the pandemic and then the various conflicts in the country. As such, Sweden, like the other donors in the trust fund, agreed to a no-cost extension for one more year for the entire program, which meant that the new end date for ESAP3 is now November 2024.
